alert.note: Alert for Garland; Montgomery; Perry; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 16 at 5:30AM CDT until April 16 at 5:45AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN PERRY...WESTERN GARLAND...SOUTHWESTERN YELL AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 530 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Fourche Valley to 11 miles west of Lake Ouachita State Park to 8 miles northwest of Meyers to near Mount Ida to near Norman, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mount Ida... Mountain Pine... Norman... Oden... Mimosa... Meyers... Lake Ouachita State Park... Mauldin... Avant... Black Springs... Mt Tabor... Sunshine... Fannie... Royal... Lena Landing Rec Area... Fancyhill... Hamilton... Story... Chula... Gibbs... TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
